00026 #include <google/dense_hash_map>
00027 
00028 #include <string>
00029 #include <map>
00030 #include <cstdlib>
00031 
00032 #include "StaticString.h"

00034 namespace Passenger {
00035 
00036 using namespace std;
00037 using namespace google;
00038 
00039 /**
00040  * A parser for SCGI requests. It parses the request header and ignores the
00041  * body data.
00042  *
00043  * You can use it by constructing a parser object, then feeding data to the
00044  * parser until it has reached a final state.
00045  *
00046  * Example:
00047  * @code
00048  *    ScgiRequestParser parser;
00049  *    char buf[1024 * 16];
00050  *    ssize_t size;
00051  *    unsigned in bytesAccepted;
00052  *    
00053  *    do {
00054  *        size = read(fd, buf, sizeof(buf));
00055  *        bytesAccepted = parser.feed(buf, size);
00056  *    } while (parser.acceptingInput());
00057  *    // Parser is done when its return value isn't equal to the input size.
00058  *    
00059  *    // Check whether a parse error occured.
00060  *    if (parser.getState() == ScgiRequestParser::ERROR) {
00061  *        bailOut();
00062  *    } else {
00063  *        // All good! Do something with the SCGI header that the parser parsed.
00064  *        processHeader(parser.getHeaderData());
00065  *        
00066  *        // If the last buffer passed to the parser also contains body data,
00067  *        // then the body data starts at 'buf + bytesAccepted'.
00068  *        if (bytesAccepted < size) {
00069  *            processBody(buf + bytesAccepted);
00070  *        }
00071  *        while (!end_of_file(fd)) {
00072  *            ... read(...) ...
00073  *            processBody(...);
00074  *        }
00075  *    }
00076  * @endcode
00077  *
00078  * Parser properties:
00079  * - A parser object can only process a single SCGI request. You must discard
00080  *   the existing parser object and create a new one if you want to process
00081  *   another SCGI request.
00082  * - This parser checks whether the header netstring is valid. It will enter
00083  *   the error state if it encounters a parse error.
00084  * - However, this parser does not perform any validation of the actual header
00085  *   contents. For example, it doesn't check that CONTENT_LENGTH is the first
00086  *   header, or that the SCGI header is present.
00087  */
00088 class ScgiRequestParser {
00089 public:
00090         enum State {
00091                 READING_LENGTH_STRING,
00092                 READING_HEADER_DATA,
00093                 EXPECTING_COMMA,
00094                 DONE,
00095                 ERROR
00096         };
00097         
00098         enum ErrorReason {
00099                 NONE,
00100                 
00101                 /** The length string is too large. */
00102                 LENGTH_STRING_TOO_LARGE,
00103                 
00104                 /** The header is larger than the maxSize value provided to the constructor. */
00105                 LIMIT_REACHED,
00106                 
00107                 /** The length string contains an invalid character. */
00108                 INVALID_LENGTH_STRING,
00109                 
00110                 /** A header terminator character (",") was expected, but some else
00111                  * was encountered instead. */
00112                 HEADER_TERMINATOR_EXPECTED,
00113                 
00114                 /** The header data itself contains errors. */
00115                 INVALID_HEADER_DATA
00116         };
00117         
00118 private:
00119         typedef dense_hash_map<StaticString, StaticString, StaticString::Hash> HeaderMap;
00120         
00121         unsigned long maxSize;
00122         
00123         State state;
00124         ErrorReason errorReason;
00125         char lengthStringBuffer[sizeof("4294967296")];
00126         unsigned int lengthStringBufferSize;
00127         unsigned long headerSize;
00128         string headerBuffer;
00129         HeaderMap headers;
00130         
00131         static inline bool isDigit(char byte) {
00132                 return byte >= '0' && byte <= '9';
00133         }
00134         
00135         /**
00136          * Parse the given header data into key-value pairs.
00137          */
00138         bool parseHeaderData(const string &data, HeaderMap &output) {
00139                 bool isName = true; // Whether we're currently expecting a name or a value.
00140                 const char *startOfString, *current, *end;
00141                 StaticString key, value;
00142                 
00143                 if (data.size() == 0) {
00144                         return true;
00145                 }
00146                 
00147                 startOfString = data.c_str();
00148                 end           = data.c_str() + data.size();
00149                 
00150                 if (*(end - 1) != '\0') {
00151                         return false;
00152                 }
00153                 
00154                 for (current = data.c_str(); current != end; current++) {
00155                         if (isName && *current == '\0') {
00156                                 key = StaticString(startOfString, current - startOfString);
00157                                 if (key.empty()) {
00158                                         return false;
00159                                 }
00160                                 startOfString = current + 1;
00161                                 isName = false;
00162                         } else if (!isName && *current == '\0') {
00163                                 value = StaticString(startOfString, current - startOfString);
00164                                 startOfString = current + 1;
00165                                 isName = true;
00166                                 
00167                                 output[key] = value;
00168                                 key   = StaticString();
00169                                 value = StaticString();
00170                         }
00171                 }
00172                 
00173                 return isName;
00174         }
00175         
00176         /**
00177          * Process the given data, which contains header data and possibly
00178          * some body data as well.
00179          */
00180         unsigned int readHeaderData(const char *data, unsigned int size) {
00181                 unsigned int bytesToRead;
00182                 
00183                 // Calculate how many bytes of header data is left to be read.
00184                 // Do not read past the header data.
00185                 if (size < headerSize - headerBuffer.size()) {
00186                         bytesToRead = size;
00187                 } else {
00188                         bytesToRead = headerSize - headerBuffer.size();
00189                 }
00190                 // Append the newly received header data to the header data buffer.
00191                 headerBuffer.append(data, bytesToRead);
00192                 
00193                 if (headerBuffer.size() == headerSize) {
00194                         // We've received all header data. Now attempt to parse this.
00195                         if (bytesToRead < size) {
00196                                 if (data[bytesToRead] == ',') {
00197                                         if (parseHeaderData(headerBuffer, headers)) {
00198                                                 state = DONE;
00199                                                 return bytesToRead + 1;
00200                                         } else {
00201                                                 state = ERROR;
00202                                                 errorReason = INVALID_HEADER_DATA;
00203                                                 return bytesToRead;
00204                                         }
00205                                 } else {
00206                                         state = ERROR;
00207                                         errorReason = HEADER_TERMINATOR_EXPECTED;
00208                                         return bytesToRead;
00209                                 }
00210                         } else {
00211                                 if (parseHeaderData(headerBuffer, headers)) {
00212                                         state = EXPECTING_COMMA;
00213                                 } else {
00214                                         state = ERROR;
00215                                         errorReason = INVALID_HEADER_DATA;
00216                                 }
00217                                 return bytesToRead;
00218                         }
00219                 } else {
00220                         // Not all header data has been received yet.
00221                         return bytesToRead;
00222                 }
00223         }
00224         
00225 public:
00226         /**
00227          * Create a new ScgiRequestParser, ready to parse a request.
00228          *
00229          * @param maxSize The maximum size that the SCGI data is allowed to
00230          *                be, or 0 if no limit is desired.
00231          */
00232         ScgiRequestParser(unsigned long maxSize = 0) {
00233                 this->maxSize = maxSize;
00234                 state = READING_LENGTH_STRING;
00235                 errorReason = NONE;
00236                 lengthStringBufferSize = 0;
00237                 headerSize = 0;
00238                 headers.set_empty_key("");
00239         }
00240         
00241         /**
00242          * Feed SCGI request data to the parser.
00243          *
00244          * @param data The data to feed.
00245          * @param size The size of the data, in bytes.
00246          * @return The number of recognized SCGI header bytes. If this value
00247          *         equals 'size', then it means all data in 'data' is part of
00248          *         the SCGI header. If this value is less than size, then it
00249          *         means only some data in 'data' is part of the SCGI header,
00250          *         and the remaining 'size - result' bytes are part of the
00251          *         request body.
00252          * @pre size > 0
00253          * @post result <= size
00254          * @post if result <= size: getState() == DONE || getState() == ERROR
00255          */
00256         unsigned int feed(const char *data, unsigned int size) {
00257                 unsigned int i;
00258                 
00259                 switch (state) {
00260                 case READING_LENGTH_STRING:
00261                         // Keep processing length string data...
00262                         for (i = 0; i < size; i++) {
00263                                 char byte = data[i];
00264                                 
00265                                 if (lengthStringBufferSize == sizeof(lengthStringBuffer) - 1) {
00266                                         // ...and abort if the length string is too long.
00267                                         state = ERROR;
00268                                         errorReason = LENGTH_STRING_TOO_LARGE;
00269                                         return i;
00270                                 } else if (!isDigit(byte)) {
00271                                         if (byte == ':') {
00272                                                 // ...until the end of the length string has been reached.
00273                                                 state = READING_HEADER_DATA;
00274                                                 lengthStringBuffer[lengthStringBufferSize] = '\0';
00275                                                 headerSize = atol(lengthStringBuffer);
00276                                                 if (maxSize > 0 && headerSize > maxSize) {
00277                                                         state = ERROR;
00278                                                         errorReason = LIMIT_REACHED;
00279                                                 } else {
00280                                                         headerBuffer.reserve(headerSize);
00281                                                         // From here on, process the rest of the data that we've
00282                                                         // received, as header data.
00283                                                         return readHeaderData(data + i + 1, size - i - 1) + i + 1;
00284                                                 }
00285                                         } else {
00286                                                 // ...until we encounter a parse error.
00287                                                 state = ERROR;
00288                                                 errorReason = INVALID_LENGTH_STRING;
00289                                                 return i;
00290                                         }
00291                                 } else {
00292                                         lengthStringBuffer[lengthStringBufferSize] = byte;
00293                                         lengthStringBufferSize++;
00294                                 }
00295                         }
00296                         return i;
00297                 
00298                 case READING_HEADER_DATA:
00299                         return readHeaderData(data, size);
00300                 
00301                 case EXPECTING_COMMA:
00302                         if (data[0] == ',') {
00303                                 state = DONE;
00304                                 return 1;
00305                         } else {
00306                                 state = ERROR;
00307                                 errorReason = HEADER_TERMINATOR_EXPECTED;
00308                                 return 0;
00309                         }
00310                 
00311                 default:
00312                         return 0;
00313                 }
00314         }
00315         
00316         /**
00317          * Get the raw header data that has been processed so far.
00318          */
00319         string getHeaderData() const {
00320                 return headerBuffer;
00321         }
00322         
00323         /**
00324          * Get the value of the header with the given name.
00325          * Lookup is case-sensitive.
00326          *
00327          * Returns the empty string if there is no such header.
00328          *
00329          * @pre getState() == DONE
00330          */
00331         StaticString getHeader(const StaticString &name) const {
00332                 HeaderMap::const_iterator it(headers.find(name));
00333                 if (it == headers.end()) {
00334                         return "";
00335                 } else {
00336                         return it->second;
00337                 }
00338         }
00339         
00340         /**
00341          * Checks whether there is a header with the given name.
00342          * Lookup is case-sensitive.
00343          *
00344          * @pre getState() == DONE
00345          */
00346         bool hasHeader(const StaticString &name) const {
00347                 return headers.find(name) != headers.end();
00348         }
00349         
00350         /**
00351          * Get the parser's current state.
00352          */
00353         State getState() const {
00354                 return state;
00355         }
00356         
00357         /**
00358          * Returns the reason why the parser entered the error state.
00359          *
00360          * @pre getState() == ERROR
00361          */
00362         ErrorReason getErrorReason() const {
00363                 return errorReason;
00364         }
00365         
00366         /**
00367          * Checks whether this parser is still capable of accepting input (that
00368          * is, that this parser is not in a final state).
00369          */
00370         bool acceptingInput() const {
00371                 return state != DONE && state != ERROR;
00372         }
00373 };
00374 
00375 } // namespace Passenger
